Classical.Structure: Extracellular vesicle (30-150 nm) released by cells.
Classical.Function: Intercellular communication, transporting proteins, lipids, and RNA.
Classical.Pathology: Role in cancer metastasis and prion disease spread.

SCPN.L1_QuantumBiological: Functions as 'Quantum Mail'. A protected, mobile quantum system designed to transport a coherent, entangled payload (RNA, proteins) and preserve its state during intercellular transit via a high energy barrier (E_vesicle) and quantum recognition targeting. [cite: 1480, 1490, 1828-1838]

Symbolic.MetaphysicalMapping: A carrier of information, shielded from the outside world. A discrete packet of identity and intent.

Falsification_Hypotheses: The cargo (e.g., RNA) of an exosome will show no evidence of a coherent quantum state.
Exosome targeting will be fully explained by classical lock-and-key receptor affinity, with no measurable quantum recognition signature (S_quantum <= 1). [cite: 1837]
Experimental_Protocols: Isolate exosomes and measure the quantum coherence of their cargo.
Test exosome binding specificity against quantum recognition models (P_binding = |\langle\Psi_{target}|M_{surface}|\Psi_{targeting}\rangle|^2)
